title: Venezuela’s interim government says it is united behind Maduro after his U.S. capture
byline: A top Venezuelan official declared on Sunday that the country’s government would stay unified behind President Nicolas Maduro, whose capture by the United States has sparked deep uncertainty about what is next for the oil-rich South American nation. M0RE..

title: All schools to commence for 2026 academic year today
byline: All schools are scheduled to commence the first phase of the first term of the 2026 academic year today (05).

title: Moscow airports shut over Ukrainian drone threat
byline: Three out of four of Moscow’s airports shut to air traffic on Sunday (Jan 4) after Ukraine launched dozens of drones at the Russian capital, authorities said.

title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island today
byline: The low-level atmospheric disturbance is currently established to the southeast of the island, the Department of Meteorology said.

title: 56-year old woman arrested with over 100 bottles of illicit liquor
byline: A female suspect has been arrested in the Bajangoda area of the Meerigama Police Division with 1,080 litres of “Goda”  (six barrels) used for the illegal distillation of liquor, 81 litres of illicit liquor (109 bottles), and equipment used for brewing.

title: Hollywood starts 2026 with ‘Avatar: Fire and Ash’ No. 1, as James Cameron’s sci-fi epic crosses $1B
byline: Hollywood kicked off 2026 with “Avatar: Fire and Ash” atop the box office for the third straight week and with hopes for a blockbuster-filled year after a disappointing 2025.

title: Former Minister Johnston Fernando appears before FCID
byline: Former Minister Johnston Fernando has appeared before the Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID) today (05).

title: Trump says second Venezuela strike possible if government does not cooperate
byline: U.S. President Donald Trump said on Sunday that the United States might launch a second military strike on Venezuela following the capture of President Nicolas Maduro if remaining members of the administration do not cooperate with his efforts to get the country “fixed.”

title: Dy Foreign Minister says actions underway on Sri Lankan fishing vessel destroyed in Seychelles Waters
byline: Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs and Foreign Employment, Arun Hemachandra, says measures are currently being taken by coordinating with officials of the Sri Lankan High Commission in Seychelles regarding the seizure and destruction of a foreign fishing vessel within the Seychelles maritime zone.

title: Three arrested for illegal excavation of artifacts in Thanamalwila
byline: A total of three suspects have been arrested by the Thanamalwila Police in connection with illegal excavations carried out in search of artifacts.

title: Nicolás Maduro will appear in U.S. federal court today
byline: Nicolás Maduro is set to make his first appearance in U.S. federal court today.

title: Interim Venezuelan leader invites Trump to ‘collaborate,’ seeks ‘respectful relations’
byline: Interim Venezuelan leader Delcy Rodríguez invited U.S. President Donald Trump “to collaborate” and said she seeks “respectful relations” in a newly conciliatory message released Sunday night.

title: Principals’ Association alleges absence of formal educational plan for Grade 6 students
byline: The General Secretary of the Graded Principals’ Association, Nimal Mudunkotuwa, stated that although schools commenced the 2026 academic year today (05), the government has yet to introduce a formal educational plan for Grade 6 students.

title: Gold price rises after US captures Venezuela’s Maduro
byline: Precious metal prices have risen after the US capture of Venezuelan President Nicolás Maduro increased investors’ concerns about geopolitical risks.

title: 28,333 individuals inspected during nationwide special operations
byline: Under a special nationwide operation to curb crime and narcotics, a total of 22 suspects directly linked to various criminal activities have been arrested.

title: Ex-Minister Rishad Bathiudeen appears before Bribery Commission
byline: Former Minister and Member of Parliament Rishad Bathiudeen has appeared before the Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) this morning (05), following a summon issued by the commission.

title: Sri Lanka generated USD 11B from tourism and remittances in 2025 – FM
byline: The Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment, and Tourism, Vijitha Herath, announced that 2025 has become the year with the highest foreign remittance inflows to Sri Lanka since 2016.

title: Critics Choice Awards 2025: Jimmy Kimmel wins Best Talk Show, thanks Trump for ‘doing many ridiculous things every day’
byline: Television host and comedian Jimmy Kimmel won the award for Best Talk Show at the 31st annual Critics Choice Awards and used his acceptance speech to deliver a satirical message aimed at US President Donald Trump, according to Variety.

title: Former Minister Johnston Fernando and son arrested by FCID
byline: Former Minister Johnston Fernando and his youngest son, Gerome Kenneth Fernando, have been arrested by the Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID) after appearing before the division earlier this morning (05).

title: China says it cannot accept countries acting as ‘world judge’ after US captures Maduro
byline: Chinese Foreign Minister Wang Yi said Beijing cannot accept any country acting as the “world’s judge” after the United States captured Venezuela’s President Nicolas Maduro.

title: Ramboda Wavendon Tamil Vidyalaya to be relocated due to risk of landslides
byline: A decision has been taken to relocate the Wavendon Tamil Maha Vidyalaya in Ramboda due to the risk of landslides.

title: Customized meal service to be introduced at govt. hospitals, beginning at Apeksha Hospital
byline: A special programme has been introduced by the Ministry of Health with the aim of providing high-quality, nutritious and appetizing meals for patients receiving inpatient care at government hospitals.

title: Man alleges physical assault by police following case of mistaken identity
byline: A resident of Deraniyagala has accused officers attached to the Borella Police of physically assaulting him after allegedly mistaking him for a suspect wanted in connection with a recent shooting incident in Dehiwala.

title: Oil prices slip after Donald Trump’s Venezuela strikes
byline: Oil prices fell on Monday as adequate global supplies offset concerns about supply disruptions due to the U.S. capture of Venezuelan President Nicolas Maduro in an audacious raid over the weekend.

title: Venezuela’s interim president offers US cooperation after Trump says further strike possible
byline: Venezuela’s acting president offered on Sunday to collaborate with the United States on an agenda focused on “shared development”, striking a conciliatory tone for the first time since U.S. forces captured the oil-rich nation’s president, Nicolas Maduro.

title: Samsung to double AI mobile devices to 800 million units this year
byline: Samsung Electronics plans to double this year the number of its mobile devices with “Galaxy AI” features largely powered by Google’s Gemini, its co-CEO said, which would give the U.S. firm an edge over rivals as the global race in artificial intelligence heats up.

title: Sri Lanka targets 3 million tourists in 2026
byline: Sri Lanka is targeting 3 million tourist arrivals in 2026, a top official said on Monday, after a record 2.36 million last year, as the country seeks to boost revenue and support recovery from Cyclone Ditwah.

title: Low-level atmospheric disturbance to southeast of Sri Lanka likely to intensify further
byline: The low-level atmospheric disturbance to the southeast of Sri Lanka is predicted to intensify further in the next few days.

title: Disciplinary action taken against 500 police officers over drug-related offences: IGP
byline: Disciplinary action has been taken against approximately 500 police officers in connection with drug-related offences, Inspector General of Police Priyantha Weerasooriya has stated.

title: US attacks Venezuela: Handcuffed Maduro arrives at New York court on drug trafficking charges
byline: Venezuela’s deposed leader Nicolas Maduro arrived at a New York court on Monday to face drug charges while the U.N. was to debate the legality of U.S. President Donald Trump’s extraordinary operation to capture him.

title: Use budget allocations efficiently for the benefit of people, President directs officials
byline: The budgetary allocations for 2026 have been made within the existing fiscal constraints by identifying national priorities and that it is the responsibility of all Secretaries of Ministries and public officials to utilise these funds with maximum efficiency for the benefit of the people, stated President Anura Kumara Dissanayake.

title: Tuition classes targeting 2025 A/L exam prohibited from midnight tomorrow
byline: The Department of Examinations has announced that all tuition classes, lectures, and seminars related to the 2025 G.C.E. Advanced Level (A/L) Examination will be prohibited from midnight on January 06 (Tuesday).

title: Former Minister Johnston Fernando and his youngest son remanded
byline: Former Minister Johnston Fernando and his youngest son, Jerome Kenneth Fernando who were arrested by the Financial Crimes Investigation Division (FCID) earlier today (05), have been remanded.

title: Switzerland freezes assets linked to Venezuela’s Maduro after US arrest
byline: Switzerland has frozen any assets held in the country by Venezuela’s Nicolas Maduro and associates, the governing Federal Council said on Monday, following his arrest by U.S. forces in Caracas and transfer to the United States.

title: Former Minister Navin Dissanayake appointed Vice Chairman of UNP
byline: Former Minister Navin Dissanayake has been appointed as the Vice Chairman of the United National Party (UNP).

title: CBSL extends suspension on Perpetual Treasuries
byline: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) has decided to extend the suspension of Perpetual Treasuries Limited (PTL) from carrying on the business and activities of a Primary Dealer for a further period of six months.

title: Myanmar pro-military party wins first phase of junta-run election: Official results
byline: Myanmar’s dominant pro-military party won the first phase of junta-run elections, the last released official results showed on Monday (Jan 5), with the USDP taking nearly 90 per cent of lower house seats.

title: Sri Lanka sees 2025 apparel export growth despite November dip
byline: The latest figures show an increase in Sri Lanka apparel exports in 2025 compared to $4.34bn recorded during the same period in 2024.

title: ASP and Woman Police Sergeant arrested for soliciting bribes
byline: An Assistant Superintendent of Police attached to the Office of the Nuwara Eliya Assistant Superintendent of Police and a Woman Police Sergeant attached to the Office of the Kalmunai Assistant Superintendent of Police have been arrested for soliciting and accepting bribes.

title: Suspect in custody after incident at US VP JD Vance’s home
byline: A suspect is in custody following an incident that occurred at the home of Vice President of the United States JD Vance Monday morning, according to local media reports.

title: UN Secretary General ‘concerned international law not respected’
byline: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres says he is “deeply concerned that rules of international law have not been respected” during US military action in Venezuela.

title: Sri Lankan family at Tamil Nadu refugee camp seeking to return home citing lack of amenities
byline: A family that fled to Tamil Nadu as refugees due to the economic crisis in Sri Lanka has submitted a petition at the Ramanathapuram Collector’s public grievance meeting, requesting to be sent back to the home country.

title: Sri Lanka deeply concerned about developments in Venezuela: MFA
byline: Sri Lanka is deeply concerned about the recent developments in Venezuela and is closely monitoring the situation, the government has stated.

title: Fuel prices revised
byline: The Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (Ceypetco) has announced a revision of fuel prices effective from midnight today (05).

title: Landslide warnings issued to residents of three districts
byline: Early landslide warnings have been issued to residents of three Divisional Secretariat divisions in three districts owing to incessant rains experienced in parts of the island.
